main event: The report details a sighting of a bright red, oblong-shaped object, the size of a B-36 bomber, traveling at high speeds without making any sound over San Francisco in 1952.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be traveling at around 1500-4500 mph, far exceeding the capabilities of known aircraft at the time.
The visual observation was made by a credible source, the CGC post phone, enhancing the reliability of the report.
The absence of a sound despite the high speed and the oblong shape of the object are unusual characteristics for conventional aircraft.
The location of the sighting over San Francisco, a highly populated and well-documented area, adds weight to the report.
The report includes multiple references to high visibility, indicating clear atmospheric conditions during the sighting.
